alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 15 at 12:29PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Junction CO has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Utah... Green River near Jensen affecting Eastern Uinta Basin. .The combination of warm, spring temperatures and the potential for periods of heavy rain falling on a deep snowpack would lead to an increase in runoff from snowmelt. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and are expected to reach critical levels by the end of the week. Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Green River Jensen 10.8 8.7 Mon 8 am MDT 9.1 9.9 10.4 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the watch being upgraded to an advisory or warning. UTZ024-171830- /O.NEW.KGJT.FL.A.0003.230516T1000Z-000000T0000Z/ /JESU1.0.RS.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 1229 PM MDT Mon May 15 2023 ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Green River near Jensen. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, minor lowland flooding is expected along the Green River, impacting agricultural land and a few out buildings near the river. At 10.8 feet, The Green River has reached flood stage. Irrigation pumps and equipment near the river are impacted and water begins to flow into portions of the mobile home park near Stewart Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM MDT Monday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 10.8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
